intro: Tripleurospermum fissurale, commonly known as the fissured hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is an annual or biennial plant that blooms from late spring to early autumn.
